sentence3: When our backs were turned our cat jumped onto the table.
sentence4: She began to lick the cheese off the pizza, ruining our delicious meal.
sentence5: I could not believe my eyes and we thoroughly scolded the cat.

sentence1: My family's old barn collapsed one night.
sentence2: We were out working one day cleaning it up.
sentence3: There was a large section of board covered in rusty nails.
sentence4: Someone stepped onto the boards and got stabbed by the nails.
sentence5: We had to take them to get a tetanus shot right away.

sentence1: I was in Peru on a mission trip.
sentence2: When we arrived at the house, there were many fruit trees.
sentence3: I could not believe my eyes when i saw a star fruit tree.
sentence4: My friends and I picked as many as we could eat.
sentence5: There is nothing better than a star fruit right off the tree.

sentence1: One day at the zoo, I walked over to the gorilla enclosure.
sentence2: A large male silverback gorilla walked out from the corner.
sentence3: He sat in the center of the viewing area, as if posing.
sentence4: He glared angrily at me the entire time I was there.
sentence5: I felt very guilty, like I shouldn't be there looking at him.

sentence1: Pink the Pink Gin was obtained through an evening of play.
sentence2: Caleb wanted to use a special claw machine, one that was known to work.
sentence3: He tried only one time to reach the square pink penguin.
sentence4: He grabbed it with the claw, and squealed with excitement.
sentence5: He took it home with him that night, happy he had won a prize.

sentence1: I recently lost a lot of weight.
sentence2: Despite this, my feet and legs remained swollen from edema.
sentence3: Every day, I had to put on a pair of compression socks.
sentence4: The socks helped bring the swelling down all day.
sentence5: At the end of the day, my legs weren't as swollen as they used to be.

sentence1: I lost a lot of weight using healthy eating habits.
sentence2: Every day, I ate 5 to 9 servings of fruits and vegetables.
sentence3: I piled things like broccoli up on my plate while ignoring fats.
sentence4: Eventually, I lost 80 pounds of fat and water.
sentence5: The accumulated fluids left my body in only a few months.

sentence1: We had a huge fight this morning over the coffee.
sentence2: Every time I make it, Mack says I'm doing it wrong.
sentence3: He tells me I cook the water too long once the coffee drips in.
sentence4: I think it tastes better with the slightly roasted flavor.
sentence5: He refused to drink any of it, so I ended up drinking the entire pot.

sentence1: I dyed my black hair with pink temporary coloring.
sentence2: First I bleached a large portion of my hair.
sentence3: Then I applied organic bright pink vegetable dye.
sentence4: I washed it out in the bathtub, leaving a pink ring.
sentence5: The dye will last about 6 weeks.

sentence1: The last time I went to my uncle's house, we had to drive a long way.
sentence2: He lives so far out into the country that he still uses an outhouse.
sentence3: I really needed to use the bathroom, but I didn't want to go into it.
sentence4: I finally gave in and used the outhouse.
sentence5: The inside smelled terrible, and I refused to touch the seat.

sentence1: Mack was a large black lab puppy.
sentence2: He slept in bed with me every night, but his gas was terrible.
sentence3: One night, his gas was so atrocious that I moved to the couch to sleep.
sentence4: I could smell it all the way into the living room.
sentence5: Eventually he joined me on the couch.

sentence1: At an eye appointment, my doctor discovered something strange.
sentence2: He told me my eyes looked very healthy, but they were unusual.
sentence3: When he used the light to stare into them, there were red streaks.
sentence4: The streaks are natural pigmentation in my eyes, but it's very rare.
sentence5: Afterward I started developing green streaks as well.

sentence1: This morning my husband went to get dressed as he usually does.
sentence2: He walked into the bathroom and went into his closet.
sentence3: He picked out the clothing he wanted to wear, and put them on.
sentence4: When he walked out, he shut the closet door.
sentence5: The knob, however, was broken and now the door won't open.

sentence1: My best friend's father was older than most.
sentence2: He was 73 when she was born.
sentence3: He had long, black and white hairs in his beard.
sentence4: His name was Jackson, but everyone called him Jack.
sentence5: As a result, I started calling him Pepper Jack, like the cheese.

sentence1: Sam is a 6 year old boy who lives with me.
sentence2: He was abandoned by his mother, who is my cousin.
sentence3: Last week she signed temporary custody over to me.
sentence4: I have been treating him like my son ever since.
sentence5: He has been playing and having a lot of fun at my house.

storytitle: The Dog with the Heart of a Lion
sentence1: My dog died last year from old age.
sentence2: He was buried under a huge pink rose bush.
sentence3: We buried him inside his favorite carrier, a red one.
sentence4: We placed a professionally made stone on his grave.
sentence5: The inscription said he was a dog with the heart of a lion.

sentence1: Caleb was diagnosed with Sensory Processing Disorder.
sentence2: He was freaking out over sensory items and sounds.
sentence3: He fell to his knees at the loud roar of a motorcycle, covering ears.
sentence4: He ran to me for comfort afterward.
sentence5: I held him until he felt better.

sentence1: I had a dream about a large man with stringy black hair.
sentence2: He was sitting on top of my chest, staring down at me.
sentence3: I was awake, with my eyes open, unable to move.
sentence4: This lasted for about a minute, then I was finally able to move again.
sentence5: I later found out this was called sleep paralysis.

sentence1: My son was diagnosed with Autism.
sentence2: He went to see a top notch child psychiatrist.
sentence3: They tested him over a course of 3 days.
sentence4: They played with him and ran tests.
sentence5: In conclusion, they decided he was PDD-NOS.

sentence1: My biological father had some chest pains one day.
sentence2: He went to see his doctor, who told him his heart was enlarged.
sentence3: He was referred to a hospital in another town.
sentence4: While there, they found he had severe heart disease.
sentence5: He ended up dying on the operating table the same day.

sentence1: One day my brother hit me in the stomach.
sentence2: He'd done so many times before, but this time I snapped.
sentence3: I grabbed my little league bat and chased him with it.
sentence4: I ended up hitting him in the head with the bat twice.
sentence5: He wasn't really injured, because I was so little.

sentence1: My mom bought a porcelain dog for the porch.
sentence2: He's very realistic looking, so he tricked everyone.
sentence3: People walked up to the door, looked down and jumped.
sentence4: They thought there was adorable puppy staring up at them.
sentence5: They laughed when they realized it wasn't real.

sentence1: On the last trip to the zoo, I took my 11 year old son.
sentence2: His favorite part was the chinese pandas.
sentence3: He had never seen them before, as they are rare in the United States.
sentence4: There were 2 of them, lying around on top of rocks behind glass.
sentence5: They didn't even look up at us the entire time we were there.

sentence1: My ex husband has been calling me every day.
sentence2: I changed my number after he left, but somehow he got it anyway.
sentence3: He just called me a few minutes ago, and left a message.
sentence4: I'm thankful he's in another state, so the calls are all he can do.
sentence5: I worry about him calling me all the time.

sentence1: When I was 13, my boyfriend's favorite color was purple.
sentence2: I decided purple was my favorite color too, and painted my bedroom.
sentence3: Every wall was violet, and I loved it very much.
sentence4: Then he broke up with me, and I was very sad.
sentence5: I rebelled by repainting my room neon green, a very ugly color.

sentence1: I have a fear of severed heads.
sentence2: I developed it after witnessing the death of one of my best friends.
sentence3: I have no memory of the accident, but she was beheaded by a semi.
sentence4: I know I saw it only because others told me I did after the accident.
sentence5: I never regained my memory of that day.

storytitle: The Little Brown Desk that Could
sentence1: I couldn't find a place to put my new computer.
sentence2: I finally decided to move a small brown desk into my bedroom.
sentence3: The desk wasn't sturdy at all, but was actually a little wobbly.
sentence4: I put the computer on top, and used a dining chair to sit in front.
sentence5: Now I have a work station, even though it isn't a very good one.

sentence1: I walked out to the tree to look for cicadas.
sentence2: I found casings they had shed all over the tree.
sentence3: I pulled them off and inspected them out of curiosity.
sentence4: They were brown, dry and crumbly.
sentence5: I put them back on the tree the way I had found them.

sentence1: My stuffed bear came from the grocery store.
sentence2: I found him on a sales rack for only $3.
sentence3: He was brown and fluffy, and wore a purple sleeping cap.
sentence4: I took him home and placed him on my bed.
sentence5: I sleep with him and my Charlie Horse every single night.

sentence1: I learned how to play Rock Paper Scissors when I was an adult.
sentence2: I got into an argument with my friend, and he suggested we use it.
sentence3: I had no idea what I was doing, so I lost every turn.
sentence4: Eventually I got better at it, and won a few rounds.
sentence5: He gave up after I started winning every time.

sentence1: I got mad at my brother when I was three years old.
sentence2: I grabbed a chair and pulled it up to a pencil sharpener in his room.
sentence3: I methodically sharpened the pencil in the sharpener.
sentence4: I walked over to my brother and stabbed it into his forearm.
sentence5: He had a small piece of lead permanently imbedded in his arm.

sentence1: When I got my brand new laptop, I was ecstatic.
sentence2: I had saved for months to buy it, and now I had it open in front of me.
sentence3: When my phone rang, I reached for it without thinking.
sentence4: I bumped my drink, spilling grape juice all over the laptop.
sentence5: From that moment on, I've been using a Minnie sippy while I work.

sentence1: I fell for the cabbage patch kid craze at an early age.
sentence2: I had several of the dolls, but I decided one day I was going to grow.
sentence3: I planted cabbage seeds in my grandma's garden.
sentence4: Every time I visited, I lifted the leaves looking for a new doll.
sentence5: I finally gave up when the cabbage started to rot away.

sentence1: The last day of my relationship was a very difficult one.
sentence2: I had to accept that things had simply changed between us.
sentence3: I went through the motions of a regular day, but I was heartbroken.
sentence4: I ended up consoling myself with popcorn and an old sappy movie.
sentence5: After I had a good cry watching the movie, I felt a little bit better.

sentence1: In 2014, I stopped at a sanctuary on a job call.
sentence2: I had to fix a computer for a monk, who made wine and fruit cake.
sentence3: They sold the wine and fruit cakes locally, so I purchased a cake.
sentence4: It was the most delicious cake I'd ever had, and I hate fruit cake.
sentence5: I realized that day that commercial fruit cakes are not the real thing.

sentence1: I bought my pink phone as soon as it became available.
sentence2: I had wanted one for a very long time.
sentence3: When I heard it was out, I rushed to the store.
sentence4: I purchased one of the only ones they had left in stock.
sentence5: I paid more for the color, but it was worth it in my opinion.

sentence1: Windell called me yesterday on my cell phone.
sentence2: I hadn't heard from him in 20 years, but we picked up like old friends.
sentence3: He talked about wrestling and his diabetes for most of the call.
sentence4: We decided to meet and chat about the good old days some time soon.
sentence5: I hung up feeling better about my hard day.

sentence1: Yesterday, I suddenly received a text from an old boyfriend.
sentence2: I hadn't spoken to him since I was 12 years old.
sentence3: At 35, he was asking me to meet him for lunch in downtown Memphis.
sentence4: I told him I was unable to, as I am in a serious relationship.
sentence5: He left me his number in case I ever change my mind.

sentence1: I had a swimming party at my house one summer.
sentence2: I invited over lots of different girls from school.
sentence3: They all came to the party, except one.
sentence4: She showed up with her parents, because they wanted to meet me.
sentence5: We quickly became best friends that summer.

sentence1: I bought a red leather sofa sectional last month.
sentence2: I paid $500 to purchase it from an elderly gentleman over a weekend.
sentence3: I picked it up using my minivan, with the seats in the back removed.
sentence4: I had to take it home in two separate sections because it didn't fit.
sentence5: When I got it home, it took up a large portion of the living room.

sentence1: At night time, my mouth was falling open frequently.
sentence2: I purchased a mouth guard in the hopes it would help.
sentence3: In the middle of the night, I awoke with pain in my jaw.
sentence4: I tried changing position several times, to no avail.
sentence5: I finally removed the guard and gave up.

sentence1: In the tenth grade, I was terrible at math.
sentence2: I refused to study, because I didn't think it would do any good.
sentence3: One morning I had a math test, and I did very badly on it.
sentence4: When the teacher handed the papers back, I was nervous.
sentence5: Everyone laughed at me because she x'd two problems, then wrote NO.

sentence1: I had a lot of difficulty waking up this morning.
sentence2: I rolled around in bed, frustrated as a song played in my mind.
sentence3: It was a song by John Lennon, one that never really became popular.
sentence4: After listening to it in my head for an hour, I gave up and got up.
sentence5: As I sat at my computer, it continued to be stuck in my head for hours.

sentence1: My husky sounds like a wolf when she howls.
sentence2: I sat beside her and howled like a dog.
sentence3: She got very excited and started howling too.
sentence4: We sang together for a long time.
sentence5: It felt like a bonding experience I'll never forget.

sentence1: I got a new modem for my computer system.
sentence2: I sat it upon the large cherry wood desk.
sentence3: The modem was huge, and took up most of the space.
sentence4: I got everything set up to work properly.
sentence5: Then I had superfast internet speeds like I always wanted.

sentence1: I couldn't sleep because my back was hurting.
sentence2: I tossed and turned for hours through the night.
sentence3: No matter how tired I was, I just could not sleep.
sentence4: I tried taking melatonin, and slept like a baby.
sentence5: I felt really great the next morning.

sentence1: I visited the beach when I was five years old.
sentence2: I tried to pick up an egg I saw in the sand.
sentence3: When I did so, a big seagull began swooping at my head.
sentence4: It was the mother bird, and she was very angry with me.
sentence5: I ran as fast as I could to get away.

sentence1: I had a huge spelling bee coming up, and I represented my school.
sentence2: I tried very hard to do a good job at the bee.
sentence3: I had been sick with the flu for weeks, and was very weak.
sentence4: I attended the county bee despite still not feeling well.
sentence5: I made it until the end, and lost in state a few months later.

sentence1: I had never mowed grass before a day in my life.
sentence2: I walked outside, worried if I could manage it.
sentence3: I tried starting the mower, and began to push it around the yard.
sentence4: It turned out to be a lot easier than I thought it would be.
sentence5: The only issue I encountered was simply that it was very hot that day.

sentence1: I was not nervous my first day of school.
sentence2: I was always around other kids, so I wasn't afraid of them.
sentence3: I was the only kid who didn't cry when my mother left me.
sentence4: I sat at my desk and played with the toys.
sentence5: She gave me a big hug at the end of the day, and said I was pretty.

sentence1: When I was a teenager, my mom and I were going on a shopping trip.
sentence2: I was really hungry, so I decided to make a snack before we left.
sentence3: I put a ham and cheese sandwich in the microwave, and asked how long.
sentence4: Mom thought I meant how long before we left, and said 10 minutes.
sentence5: I ended up burning my sandwich after putting it in for 10 minutes.

sentence1: I got mad at my brother one day after school.
sentence2: I was trying to jump on the trampoline, but he stuck his head under it.
sentence3: I jumped on it anyway, bouncing up and down on his head.
sentence4: He yelled for our mom to help him, but I didn't care.
sentence5: I was so tired of being bullied, it didn't matter anymore.

sentence1: I got a huge blister from walking for 3 miles.
sentence2: I wasn't used to the exercise, so it was rough on my feet.
sentence3: The blister swelled to epic proportions, and began to hurt.
sentence4: Unwittingly, I popped the blister.
sentence5: I found out the hard way that popped blisters are very painful.

sentence1: My first apartment was a run down cheap place to live.
sentence2: I went to the manager, and was told I could move in right away.
sentence3: I was in a rush, so I took her up on the offer and moved in.
sentence4: The rent skyrocketed at the same time that criminals began moving in.
sentence5: I eventually left, skipping rent, and moved to another state.

sentence1: I bought some black compression socks today.
sentence2: I went to the store looking for them this morning.
sentence3: I put them on up to my knees when I got home.
sentence4: I hoped they would stop the swelling in my legs.
sentence5: They are helping a little, but not very much.

sentence1: I discovered my favorite candy on a class field trip.
sentence2: In kindergarten, we took a tour of the local grocery store.
sentence3: On the way out, we were allowed to choose one item from the check out.
sentence4: I chose bubblegum in a tube that looked like a toothpaste tube.
sentence5: It was my favorite, and I purchased it for years afterward.

sentence1: When I was driving down my street one day, I passed a pipe.
sentence2: Inside the pipe was a head, sitting upright.
sentence3: Panicking, I pulled over, out of breath and terrified.
sentence4: I ran out of my car and looked into the pipe, expecting the worst.
sentence5: Turned out it was just a large doll head that looked real.

sentence1: I bought a cookie jar just for cookies in our home.
sentence2: It was a retro Beetlejuice cookie jar.
sentence3: We put it on the counter, and we can get a cookie every day from it.
sentence4: Right now it has lots of raisin cookies in it, so we can eat them.
sentence5: It's keeping the cookies nice and fresh.

sentence1: Yesterday I tried a new kind of donut.
sentence2: It was called Crunch, so I thought maybe it was cereal coated.
sentence3: I was wrong, however, as it had a crumb coating.
sentence4: It had a strong coconut flavor, which I loved.
sentence5: I decided I would buy more crunch donuts on my next store trip.

sentence1: Dubby's car broke down after school one day.
sentence2: It was called the banana boat, because it was long and yellow.
sentence3: We couldn't get it to start because it was so old and worn out.
sentence4: I ended up driving him home that day.
sentence5: We hung out at his house where we had our first kiss.

sentence1: We drove to a nearby college to compete in a band tournament.
sentence2: It was very cold, and we were freezing sitting in our seats watching.
sentence3: It didn't help that we were drinking concession stand sodas.
sentence4: I made a friend angry with me, and he threw his cup of soda and ice.
sentence5: It went all over me and down my shirt.

sentence1: I got my first rubik's cube for Christmas.
sentence2: It was wrapped in red and green paper.
sentence3: I opened it and immediately tried to figure it out.
sentence4: I worked on it for hours to no avail.
sentence5: Finally I took all the stickers off and put them where I wanted them.

sentence1: I found my favorite kind of donut this morning.
sentence2: It's small and covered with cinnamon.
sentence3: When I picked it up, I got sugar and cinnamon all over my fingers.
sentence4: I licked it off because it was so delicious.
sentence5: I tried really hard not to eat a second one.

sentence1: I have a few famous friends from my childhood.
sentence2: Jessica learned how to swim at my house when she was four.
sentence3: She clung to me and the walls of the pool as she went around them.
sentence4: She fell under water several times because she'd panic easily.
sentence5: She learned how to swim pretty quickly.

sentence1: I ate pizza at the new place with my family.
sentence2: Later that night, I was watching tv when I began to feel ill.
sentence3: I became very sick, vomiting and staying in bed for days.
sentence4: It took over a week to feel better.
sentence5: By the time it was over, I could no longer stand the sight of pizza.

sentence1: I bought my son an elf on the shelf at Christmas time.
sentence2: My elf didn't determine whether he was naughty or nice.
sentence3: This elf was a trickster, pulling pranks every night while he slept.
sentence4: The final trick was when he awoke to find his elf proposing to Barbie.
sentence5: She said yes, and we pretended to have a wedding.

sentence1: When I was three years old, I still used a binky.
sentence2: My favorite binky that I used every day said Love Bug on the front.
sentence3: I walked around with it in my mouth all the time.
sentence4: I even sucked on it at the dinner table, only taking it out to eat.
sentence5: I slept with my binky every single night that year.

sentence1: When I was four years old, I went to a relative's farm.
sentence2: On the farm, they had all kinds of animals.
sentence3: I walked behind the horses in the stable one day, and they yelled.
sentence4: They said not to walk behind the horse, but I wasn't paying attention.
sentence5: I got kicked by the horse directly in the head, knocking me down.

sentence1: My great Aunt Hazel was my favorite relative.
sentence2: One day when I was four years old, we went on a trip to her farm.
sentence3: She had several goats and pigs on her acreage.
sentence4: I walked outside all day, looking at the flowers and playing.
sentence5: I loved petting the pigs and goats at her house that day.

sentence1: At 11 years old, I always wanted a pet.
sentence2: One day, a boy rode his bike down my street, with a box in his lap.
sentence3: He opened the shoe box, and threw out a ferret into the ditch.
sentence4: I raced out and scooped up the ferret, taking it home.
sentence5: We called the police, and they said I could keep it.

sentence1: Dubby was the drummer in a band, and I always went to the practices.
sentence2: One day, I drove him home from school when his car broke down.
sentence3: He sat down on his bed facing me, his long blonde hair in his eyes.
sentence4: He leaned in and kissed me, like it was nothing.
sentence5: I was surprised, but I kissed him back.

sentence1: My grandma always wore house shoes.
sentence2: One day, she was working in her garden while I was playing.
sentence3: She saw me step on some of her flowers, and yelled at me.
sentence4: Next thing I knew, her shoe bounced off the back of my head.
sentence5: I turned to see her standing there with one shoe missing, glaring.

sentence1: When I played softball, we were always getting injured.
sentence2: One game, I got injured before it even started.
sentence3: I ran into the dugout, and slid down the bench to my teammates.
sentence4: The wooden bench was cracked, and a huge splinter went into my leg.
sentence5: I had to go to the emergency room to get it removed.

sentence1: I bought a stuffed toy with purple hair.
sentence2: She also had purple eyes and eyelashes.
sentence3: She came with a tiny stuffed baby in her arms.
sentence4: The baby had a twig of purple curly hair.
sentence5: The two came as a pair, and are very cute.

sentence1: My grandma joined a contest in her small hometown.
sentence2: She believed she had the biggest tree, and wanted to win.
sentence3: Her tree was humongous, and very old.
sentence4: She ended up winning the contest, and a check for $100.
sentence5: A picture was posted in the paper of her holding her check.

sentence1: Mozie was tired all the time, but today was worse than usual.
sentence2: She climbed under the deck and went to sleep for most of the day.
sentence3: All the coaxing in the world did not work to get her to come inside.
sentence4: It was a very hot day, so we were worried.
sentence5: Finally, she came back into the house wanting a drink of water.

sentence1: My three year old cousin came to visit.
sentence2: She found my sewing supplies and pulled out a needle.
sentence3: I told her to put it down, but she wouldn't listen.
sentence4: She stabbed me in the leg with the straight pin.
sentence5: It hurt very badly, and bled quite a bit.

sentence1: Pumpkin, my 5 year old pug, just got eye surgery.
sentence2: She got into a fight with another dog a few days ago.
sentence3: Her eye got seriously scratched in the fight.
sentence4: It will be sore for a few weeks, so I'm keeping close watch.
sentence5: She wants to scratch it, so I put a cone over her head.

sentence1: My dog is a half wolf, half husky mix.
sentence2: She has very sharp teeth that got very dirty recently.
sentence3: I took her to the vet to get them professionally cleaned.
sentence4: I waited almost an hour for her to come out from the back room.
sentence5: When they finally came out, they said she did very well.

sentence1: Cassie was my grey tabby kitten.
sentence2: She showed up abandoned in front of my house.
sentence3: She was brought inside, where I fed her and loved her.
sentence4: As she grew, she liked to play hide and go seek.
sentence5: Since she was always disappearing, we named her Casper.

sentence1: For Valentine's Day, my husband surprised me with a new puppy.
sentence2: She was an eight week old fawn pug.
sentence3: She was short and pudgy, and loved running around the room.
sentence4: She begged for a piece of pumpkin pie when I first met her.
sentence5: Because of this, I named her Pumpkin.

sentence1: A friend sent me a princess doll for my birthday, even though I 30.
sentence2: She was beautiful right out of the box, with long red curls.
sentence3: I placed her on the mantle of my fireplace to admire.
sentence4: When people come over, they often compliment her shiny porcelain skin.
sentence5: She sits on the mantle every day, never being moved from position.

sentence1: Chelsea showed up at my house at 6am.
sentence2: She was only a little girl, and nobody paid her any attention.
sentence3: Her mom got up early to play guitar, and would send her out to find me.
sentence4: We played in the ditch in front of the house that day.
sentence5: She was tired from not getting enough sleep, but we had a lot of fun.

sentence1: I took my son to see a speech therapist on Wednesday.
sentence2: She was very easy going with him.
sentence3: She helped him with his alphabet for about an hour.
sentence4: He started to improve by the end of the session.
sentence5: He had a good session with her, and left happy.

sentence1: Amber was always drinking at the river that summer.
sentence2: She would hide her beer from the people camping next to us.
sentence3: She took a canoe out on the river, but she was too drunk.
sentence4: She overturned it on a small waterfall.
sentence5: Her beer floated down the river with her swimming after it.

sentence1: When my elderly 2nd cousin died, she left behind two birds.
sentence2: The birds were peach-faced lovebirds, and they were given to me.
sentence3: I had a cage in my bedroom, but the birds frequently escaped.
sentence4: I chased them into the living room to try to close them off.
sentence5: I caught them while they sat on high shelves in the bookcase.

sentence1: My cell phone fell in the sink while I was doing dishes.
sentence2: The bubbles wrapped around the phone as it sank into the water.
sentence3: I pulled it out quickly, afraid it would do damage.
sentence4: The phone would not turn back on.
sentence5: I had to leave the house to buy a new one.

sentence1: I bought a tiny round lip gloss yesterday.
sentence2: The container was shaped like a cartoon character, drawing me in.
sentence3: I loved the smell of the gloss, and breathed it in deeply.
sentence4: After much consideration, I decided to purchase it.
sentence5: I smiled happily about my gloss as I waited to check out.

sentence1: When we went to Branson, my son drove a Duck bus.
sentence2: The driver got out of his seat, and let my son sit down in his place.
sentence3: He instructed him on how to drive the truck, and we went smoothly.
sentence4: We floated around in the water, until my son started spinning the boat.
sentence5: I had to tell him to stop as I realized what he was going to do.

sentence1: I used to collect colored pencils and erasers.
sentence2: The erasers came in all kinds of cute shapes and sizes.
sentence3: I walked to the bookstore in school and bought unicorn erasers.
sentence4: I did this every week with my allowance.
sentence5: I collected them all together in a metal tin by Lisa Frank.

sentence1: When my ex husband moved out, everything was a mess.
sentence2: The house was dirty and covered in mud from the destruction he caused.

sentence1: Kate's cousin had a baby 4 months ago.

sentence1: Hector was about to die of old age.

sentence1: Kirk had learned Chinese a long time ago in school.

sentence1: Pamela bought a tablet.

sentence1: Millie was late for work.

sentence1: Marie was terrible at keeping secrets.

sentence1: Sean bought a new dog and walked him everywhere.

sentence1: Irene liked to pull pranks on her brother.

sentence1: Hester didn't like roses.

sentence1: Colin went to bed early.

sentence1: Nina always ate very fast.

sentence1: Oliver always arrived first at his gym.

sentence1: Amelia always drank her tea with milk and sugar.

sentence1: Desmond played with his new toy when Ben came over and stole it.

sentence1: Stephanie was blind but didn't mind.

sentence1: Kristi moved in a new apartment that had a sparkling pool.

sentence1: Serena didn't like sport activities at school.

sentence1: John had a hard time at work.

sentence1: Peter was a hitman with a heart of gold.

sentence1: William was in dire need of money to save his business.

sentence1: Mason liked hacking computers.

sentence1: Alex found numbers disconcerting.

sentence1: Rodney was very clumsy.

sentence4: He tried to pay more attention to what he was doing.
sentence5: But in the end, it was easier to accept who he was and became a clown.

sentence1: Robert was very bad at dating.
sentence2: He froze every time he tried to speak to a girl.

sentence1: Miles had a short temper.

sentence1: Joseph came back from the war very disturbed.

sentence1: Jude was a real snob.

sentence1: Matt headed for Hester's office with a proposal.

sentence1: Terrence flew often in first class.

sentence1: Norman believed a lot in charity.

sentence1: When Jon felt alone, he always went to the lake.

sentence1: Jeremiah was taking karate lesson for self defense.

sentence1: Jonah wanted to hire the best employee for his firm.

sentence1: James liked to paint walls at night.

sentence1: Arnold had a small daughter and a tall son.

sentence1: Alyssa liked to work as a waitress, but she had one bad client.

sentence1: John wanted to take his wife out for a special evening.

sentence1: John didn't have a dishwasher and hated cleaning dishes.

sentence1: Peter wanted to visit Ireland during the summer.

sentence1: Josiah really loved his new hoverboard.

sentence1: When Eric received a call from the hospital, he was very worried.

sentence1: Antonio liked working in his father's pizzeria.

sentence1: Nolan always drank double espressos.

sentence1: At the end of the diner party, Joey put the dishes in the dishwasher.

sentence1: Luke was at the ice cream parlor and couldn't make his mind.

sentence1: Alex owned a lot of money to a loan shark.

sentence1: Terry was competing for his town's triathlon.

sentence1: Julian went grocery shopping in a new neighborhood.

sentence1: Simon didn't like anyone and no one liked him either.

sentence1: Jeremy stammered when he talked and people made fun of him.

sentence1: Joseph went to the garage to have his car repaired.

sentence1: Oliver was a male nurse in a big hospital.

sentence1: Denis wanted to win the race at school.

storytitle: For the love of a lawn
sentence1: Burt was very proud of his lawn.

sentence1: Carl really wanted a promotion at work.

sentence1: Steve fell in love with a woman who lived very far.

sentence1: Teresa wanted to watch her favorite show on TV.

sentence1: Jenna was good with numbers and did all her family's taxes.

sentence1: Yvonne never wore make up.

sentence1: Jocelyn lost her husband and cried all the time.

sentence1: Amelia was a plump young woman.

sentence1: About six months ago, I started doing yoga.

sentence1: Joseph was really good at driving his taxi.

sentence1: Joan was supposed to work at her novel all night.

sentence1: Tara had a bad knee.

sentence1: Carlos had one bad tooth.

sentence1: Wilbur was a very patient man.

sentence1: Lydia bought a new purse.

sentence1: When Johnny's car broke on the highway, he was stumped.

sentence1: Jessica was very soft spoken.

sentence1: Lucinda wasn't very bright.

sentence1: Nina was very bad at cooking but was striving to get better.

sentence1: Lena just arrived in the country and was struggling with money.

sentence1: Heather loved to tease Fiona.

sentence1: Nina was dreaming of world peace her whole live.

sentence1: Cecilia was very agile with her hands.
